alert.note: Alert for Carlton, South St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 4:22PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL ST. LOUIS, NORTHEASTERN CARLTON AND NORTHWESTERN DOUGLAS COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM CDT... At 422 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fond Du Lac Band Brookston Area, to near Carlton, to near Wrenshall, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Scanlon around 425 PM CDT. Carlton, Wrenshall and Thomson around 430 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Cloquet, Proctor, Oliver, Saginaw and South Range. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern Minnesota...and northwestern Wisconsin.
